page.title: 06INTERVIEW WITH MRS MORGAN
page.content: INTERVIEW WITH CTY. CLLR. MRS. MORGAN As a child I lived outside Swansea and used to come into town shopping with my mother. I moved into St. Thomas in 1946 when I married. I was a member of the Labour Party and my name was put forward as a candidate for the Council. I was elected to the Council over tewnty years ago and represent the Danygraig/Port Tennant areas. Although I had no ambitions to become a Councillor, I enjoy my job, especially the opportunity to meet new people. The thing I most dislike is making harsh decisions which affect the lives of the people which I represent. The area has not changed a great deal. Some houses were bombed in the war because the area was so near the Docks. The houses were replaced and the streets and roads have been
